positions.title: Security Professional
positions.description:
- From 2015 to 2019, I supervised three healthcare protective services guards at 
Alberta Hospital Edmonton as Shift Lead. 
- I was involved in over 3000 incidents that required my assistance. 
 As Shift Lead my duties included: Training and mentoring, delegation of daily 
duties, schedule preparation, correspondence between Alberta Health Services and 
Paladin Security, and conflict management. 
- While acting as Shift Lead, I also assisted in daily operations, such as: Patrols, 
responding to incidents and duress alarms, report writing, dispatch, equipment 
requisition, employing de-escalation tactics and Pressure Point Control Techniques, 
operating/monitoring CCTV, controlling the sites mag-locked doors, and acting 
upon alarms. 
- I have worked with RCMP, Edmonton Police Service, Emergency Medical Services, 
and the Sheriff’s Department.

allData.summary:
Education:

NAIT – EDMONTON AB – INSTRUMENTATION ENGINEERING TECHNOLOGY 
Graduate: April 2024 

- Awarded Dean’s Honor List ¾ semesters (Graduating GPA: 3.6). 
- Technical Report completed: Analysis into Cybersecurity Implementations for 
SCADA-based IIOT Systems (69 pages, 12,600 words). 
- Worked with a group on an end of school project: Designed a Distillation column 
that operated on a 4-20 mA electrical signals from a pneumatically driven standard.
- My main contributions to this project included: designing the refinery on 
Smartsketch, creating data sheets for all instruments/valves, and completing all 
Pressure Relief Valve and Orifice Plate sizing calculations. 
- Completed a System Integration project that utilized reading and writing to 
databases, fieldbus to controller, controller to controller, and HMI’s. 
- Taught operation, calibration, and maintenance for many forms of instruments and 
analyzers. 
- Utilized software’s such as: Smartsketch, Studio 5000, SCADApack 
configurator/workbench, Delta V explorer/control studio/operate, Microsoft Excel 
and more. 
- Excelled at PLC programming and System Integration. 
- Efficient in troubleshooting Instrumentation related problems. 
- Understanding of Advanced Process Control and PID Controller tuning. 
- Appreciation of Alberta Energy Regulator’s Directive 017 and the implications 
associated with it. 


Last work experience:

PROTECTIVE SERVICES SHIFT LEAD/GUARD, PALADIN SECURITY 
2013 - 2020 

- From 2015 to 2019, I supervised three healthcare protective services guards at 
Alberta Hospital Edmonton as Shift Lead. 
- I was involved in over 3000 incidents that required my assistance. 
- As Shift Lead my duties included: Training and mentoring, delegation of daily 
duties, schedule preparation, correspondence between Alberta Health Services and 
Paladin Security, and conflict management. 
- While acting as Shift Lead, I also assisted in daily operations, such as: Patrols, 
responding to incidents and duress alarms, report writing, dispatch, equipment 
requisition, employing de-escalation tactics and Pressure Point Control Techniques, 
operating/monitoring CCTV, controlling the sites mag-locked doors, and acting 
upon alarms.
